Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

Reverb 3 Filter

Discussion

This filter provides the highest quality reverb in addition to passing true stereo signals. This effect also provides a "damping" control that allows you to simulate the absorption of high frequencies by materials in a room. This filter also has an EAX emulation setting that sets the time, mix, predelay, and damping to match a given EAX room setting. This filter also includes a low-pass filter for occlusion emulation.

Preferences:

"Reverb Time": Duration of reverb. Range: 0.01 to 8000.0 milliseconds.

"Reverb Mix": Mix of reverb signal. Range: 0.00 (original - dry) to 1.0 % (fully reverb - wet).

"Reverb PreDelay": Pre-Delay before reverb. Range: 0.0 to 250.0 milliseconds.

"Reverb Damping": High frequency roll off. Range: 20.0 to 20000.0 Hz.

"Reverb EAX Environment": EAX room type. Range: Use one of the MILES_ROOM_TYPE constants.

"Lowpass Cutoff": Cutoff Frequency. Range: 20.0 to 20000.0 Hz.

"Reverb Quality": Mono or stereo. Range: 0 (mono, 2% P3/266) or 1 (stereo, 4% P3/266).


Group: Digital Filter Services
Related Sections: Reverb 1 Filter, Reverb 2 Filter
Related Basic Types: MILES_ROOM_TYPE
